aka: The History of Italy: From Unification to 2000
trans_title: The History of Italy: From Unification to 2000
introduction: The massive 30-hour history of Italy derived from the writings of three distinguished Italian historians - Valerio Castronovo, Renzo De Felice and Pietro Scoppola - and directed and edited from archive footage by Folco Quilici.The first volume of History of Italy, From the unification of Italy to Giolitti, contains the following chapters: From the unification of Italy to the new century; Industrial take-off and social transformations; The problem of national identity; La Belle Epoque; The school and literature of the new Italy; The new liberal course: Giolitti between socialists and Catholics.The second volume of History of Italy, from Giolitti's era to the Great War, contains the following chapters: Developments, contradictions and crisis under Giolitti; State and society in the Giolittiana era; Culture, politics and religion; From Adowa to intervention; Italy at war: from intervention to Caporetto; Italy at war: from the Piave to Vittorio Veneto.The third volume of History of Italy, from the Great War to Fascism, contains the following chapters: The myth of the Great War; Women and the civilian mobilization; The blighted victory; The impossible revolution; Economic recession; Fascist reaction and the crisis of the liberal state.The fourth volume of History of Italy, il regime fascista, 1922-1939, contains the following chapters: Mussolini - The early years; Fascism in power; The Matteotti crisis and the Aventine secession; The creation of the totalitarian state; The banker and entrepreneur state; Social policy.The fifth volume of History of Italy, L'Italia fascista, 1923-1939, contains the following chapters: The church and fascism; Anti-fascism and exiles; Intellectuals and Fascism; The fascist modernization; Italians under the shadow of fascism; Mass-produced consensus.The sixth volume of History of Italy, L'Italia fascista, 1923-1939, contains the following chapters: Foreign policy under fascism; A Place in the Sun; Fascism and Nazism; From non-belligerence to intervention; From parallel war to the German war; A country at war.The seventh volume of History of Italy, Dalla caduta del fascismo alla Repubblica, 1943-1946, contains the following chapters: From July 25th to September 8th, 1943; Defeat: a humiliated Nation; Salò and the "civil war"; Allies, Resistance Liberation; Death and rebirth of the Nation; From the Monarchy to the Republic.The eighth volume of History of Italy, I primi anni della Repubblica, contains the following chapters: The reconstruction; The constitutional pact and the political laceration; The economic miracle; De Gasperi's centrism; North and South; The Church from Pius XII to John XXIIIThe ninth volume of History of Italy, Una società in trasformazione, contains the following chapters: Culture amidst ideologies and social transformations; From the alliance with the West to neo-Atlantism; Italy and the European Community; The crisis of centrism; Politics and society in the sixsties; New economic models.The tenth and last volume of History of Italy, L'Italia contemporanea, contains the following chapters: Italy and Europe; National identity; Terrorism and national solidarity; After Moro: the parties crisis; The end of a political system; The metamorphoses of society.
